newsitem.title: USA: Solopoint sees Q1 revs, EPS below forecast.
newsitem.headline: Solopoint sees Q1 revs, EPS below forecast.

text.p: Solopoint Inc said revenues for the first quarter of 1997, ending March 31, will not meet expectations and expects first quarter revenue will be in the $70,000 to $80,000 range.
Earnings per share will be in the range of a loss of $0.33 to a loss of $0.36 per share versus analyst expectations of a $0.29 per share loss.
Solopoint is seeking to open new distribution channels with limited marketing resources and expects it may continue to experience wide fluctuations in quarterly sales for the foreseeable future.
This fluctuation may be caused by the timing and terms of initial stocking orders from new potential customers, coupled with its revenue recognition policies.
It said it is experiencing longer sales cycles than previously anticipated to secure distribution with Major Retailers and Regional Bell Operating Companies.
This causes the sales process and timing of an order to become uncertain which may result in distribution orders taking longer to close than anticipated.
